value: Commemorative Scrapbook Documenting the 1901 Record Breaking Coach Race from New York City to Philadelphia and Back Again

label: Description
value: Album of newspaper clippings describing the coach trip from New York to Philadelphia and return. The drivers were James H. Hyde and Alfred Vanderbilt.

label: Physical description
value: Newspaper and magazine clippings mounted on heavy wove paper, annotated in pen and ink, bound in red leather with gilded lettering

label: Description
value: View of a country house in the Gothic-Revival style at left with a large willow tree at right foreground.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on pale blue paper

label: Description
value: This asymmetrical landscape is created with two sets of circles created by the hole punching technique. One side is jagged and unrefined while the other side creates a smooth geometric shape. Between the landscapes is a negative space that is lit up with lanterns, big and small, and two crests decorated with flowers and a third crest with a little chicken.

label: Physical description
value: Mulberry paper (kozo washi) treated with fermented persimmon tannin (kakishibu)

label: Description
value: Tiny butterflies and the top of a fan looks to have been punched out using a tool carved in the shape of these objects.

label: Physical description
value: Mulberry paper (kozo washi) treated with fermented persimmon tannin (kakishibu)

label: Description
value: A series of Japanese characters have been carved using thick and thin widths. Large solid ground spaces out the characters which are scattered throughout.

label: Physical description
value: Mulberry paper (kozo washi) treated with fermented persimmon tannin (kakishibu)

label: Description
value: Multiple wisps of lines carved out form abstract hexagons. The three-pronged shape represents the pattern of a tortoiseshell, which represents longevity and good fortune. It was also popular on Samurai armor.

label: Physical description
value: Mulberry paper (kozo washi) treated with fermented persimmon tannin (kakishibu)

label: Description
value: Treetops are carved out, suggesting that the pattern works in both inversely as well. Silk threads are added to support the structure of the threads.

label: Physical description
value: Mulberry paper (kozo washi) treated with fermented persimmon tannin (kakishibu), and silk threads (itoire)

label: Description
value: Interlaced circles, also known as "seven circles" (shippo) is accompanied with blossoms. This motif refers to the seven treasures of Buddhism: gold, silver, lapis lazuli, crystal, agate, red pearl, and carnelian. These represent faith, perseverance, humility, doing no wrong, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

label: Physical description
value: Mulberry paper (kozo washi) treated with fermented persimmon tannin (kakishibu)

label: Description
value: Sashiko is a form of traditional folk embroidery using the running stitch to create patterns with symbolic meaning. Shown here are various traditional patterns such as wisteria wreaths and floral blossoms are also evenly distributed throughout the design.

label: Physical description
value: Mulberry paper (kozo washi) treated with fermented persimmon tannin (kakishibu),
